inn1.comm: begins with a wide down the leg side...a gentle loosener
on leg stump, a hint of swing but it's easily flicked out to deep square leg
that's a good one, Prior is beaten by one which straightens from outside off stump and draws the batsman into a loose push
beauty! Two in two, but this one was better. Started closer to the stumps and held its line to zip past the outside edge. Squared up Prior completely
fuller and wider outside off which allows Prior to leave alone
back of a length outside off, driven square towards backward point who can't stop it cleanly despite a good dive
worked off middle and leg to the man at deep square
on off stump, Strauss defends on the back foot to the leg side
a strangled shout for lbw as Strauss misses a pull, beaten by a lack of bounce, but it's still going well over the stumps
worked away through midwicket, nicely placed and allows time for a couple as deep square scampers around

another appeal for lbw as Strauss misses another pull, this shout is more elongated but it's pitched well outside leg stump...oh my goodness, they review it. What a waste. It started not out and it's still not out.
that's a good one outside off, pushed across Strauss who felt for it playing away from his body
back of a length and solidly defended back towards the bowler
leans forward and opens the face to guide the ball through backward point...looks for two but third man is round quickly
full outside off, drives and gets a thickish out edge down to third man
hint of width and it's met with a flowing square drive which races between point and cover...that will make Prior feel better
tighter to off stump, Prior onto the front foot and pushed down to mid-on
full on off stump and pushed firmly towards the bowler...playing with the full face is key for Prior
full on middle and off, pushed to mid-on...a decent finish to the cover
back of a length and worked into the leg side
tight on middle stump and Strauss defends...vital not to give Strauss any width
pushed off the back foot into the covers
good stuff from Rubel, on off stump and Strauss can only push it down to mid-off
goes full this time and it's driven very straight by Strauss but without quite timing it which allows mid-on to cut off the shot
angled into the pads, half an appeal but it's going well down the leg side
short on leg stump and it's tucked neatly out to deep square
back of a length on off stump and Prior defends back to the bowler
a touch straight this time, Prior works it through midwicket
that's a lovely shot, a long half volley which Prior leans into and drives it perfectly through the covers...that's how he plays in Test cricket
pushed towards leg stump, trying to compensate, and it's worked down to long leg
edged! Strauss loses control as he drives but no second slip in place, although it may have been wide of him, and it beats third man to cross the rope
sweetly timed with a back-foot drive but goes straight to cover
good line on middle and off, Prior defends straight down the pitch
touch short outside off and the width allows Prior to drive square through backward point
on the back foot, worked into the leg side and can't beat midwicket
back of a length, Prior again can't work the ball past midwicket
full on off stump, Prior defends, that's an impressive over from Rubel who has made a good start
driven off the back to cover, very slow off the surface
round the wicket, floated up and Strauss defends
wide outside off, left alone
on middle and off, Strauss defends to the leg side...showing Naeem some early respect
rocks back to make room to cut but point pulls off a good diving save...that's what Bangladesh need
ah, that's a shame, hint of width which allows Strauss to cut again and this time it flies finer through third man

gone! What a bizzare dismissal, Prior has had a brain fade. It drifted down the leg side, Prior missed it and drags his back foot. Rahim takes off the bails and Prior is just safe, but then he stays out of his crease and Rahim shows brilliant awareness to pull the stump out of the ground to complete the stumping a second time. Brainless from Prior, superb from Rahim
full on off stump, worked into the leg side and he's away first ball
over the wicket, outside off, pushed back to the bowler
punched off the back foot down to long on
pushed down the leg side again but this time Trott manages to stay in his crease
driven up to mid-on
nicely bowled, an arm ball that comes into Trott and gets trapped between bat and pad
touch short, Trott on the back foot and drives into the covers
round the wicket, angled into Strauss who defends
floated up on middle, Strauss onto the front foot
not much turn and it's played off the back foot to the bowler
ooh, nearly! Strauss rocks back to try and cut but is beaten by a touch more bounce. Almost took the edge and the bails
takes a stride forward and works down to long on
on leg stump and neatly worked out to deep square. Another tidy over.
angling into Trott who defends solidly
worked into the leg side
slightly quicker outside off, Trott chops down to backward point
leans forward and defends into the off side
tossed up a little more, Trott drives but can't beat mid-off
defends into the covers and that's a fine maiden
touch short and gives Strauss precious width to thread a cut shot through point
with midwicket put out on the boundary Trott's nurdle earns a single
what a catch from Siddique! What a catch! Strauss went back to flash a cut, it rocketed towards slip at shoulder height and Siddique was rock solid snaffling the chance. Crowd have gone ballistic
Bell stretches forward to pat back to the bowler. The stadium is heaving at the moment
calmly worked down the ground
Trott pops forward to drive to cover, goes straight to a fielder who pings back the return. Very good energy from Bangladesh so far, they look charged. Siddons will be thrilled
ooh, edged! Bell leant into a drive but a touch of spin found the edge but it went one-bounce to slip
short, too short from the bowler this time but the pressure is on England and Bell toe-ends his cut to cover
touch of air from Razzak, spin too and Bell is careful in defence
oof, this keeps very low. Burrowing through from a length to find the bottom of Bell's defensive bat
this really is low, ball not getting above ankle height. The line is excellent which gives Bell nowhere to go
maiden over, an excellent one that Bell finishes by defending very carefully
each run feels like gold, Trott threading a cover drive through the infield
outside edge runs wide of point to gift another single
quicker from the bowler, flatter too and Trott pats to mid-on
Trott pinned to his crease but the stray in line towards the pads means he can pick off a single to deep midwicket
prodded back to the bowler
again the line was a touch leg-sided but Bell pushed firmly to mid-on
Razzak is finding a touch more purchase than Naeem and it means Trott is treating him very respectfully
another dot ball piles up as Trott pushes to cover
good work from Razzak, holding his lengths and lines and Trott only prepared to defend at this stage
punched towards mid-off where the slightest midfield allows the batsmen a single
more intent on Bell's defensive push here, but not much more
another excellent Razzak over ticks by and England have just seven from the last four overs of Powerplay
overs rushing by, fielders sharp and batsmen hitting the fielders. Really good work from Bangladesh
Trott skips down the pitch, you don't often see that, meets the ball and whips to long-on
Bell this time finds long-on, standing up tall to punch a shorter ball
Trott again advances and this time works the ball around the corner to swap the strike. Good batting this over
Bell has not yet come down the track and instead defends this from the crease
good finish from Naeem makes it another good over for Bangladesh, pushing through a flatter ball that Bell pats back to him
Razzak strays wide for once, and Trott leaps at the opportunity to cut a single away
Bell skips down the wicket and has to scoot back almost as quick as his drive finds the bowler
this time Bell inside edges towards midwicket
width on offer here but Bell is struggling and can't time his drive. The crowd are sensing the pressure building
that'll do nicely for Bell, down the wicket again and this time eases down to long-off
careful defence from Trott
tidy start from Mahmudullah on a length and line around off stump
touch shorter, Bell straightens up and punches to long-on
good work from Trott, soft hands steering this wide of slip. That's the first scoring shot above a single since the end of the seventh over. Blimey!

Bangladesh alive again! What a soft dismissal. Bell chipping a length ball from around off stump gently to midwicket. He walks off shaking his head, doesn't make good viewing. Return to the bad days of Bell but dream start for Bangladesh
Morgan carefully defends his first ball back to the bowler
with a flick of the wrists, Morgan is away, turning this around the corner to keep the strike
hint of leading edge here back to the bowler
good lines from Razzak, nothing on offer for Morgan and he pats back to the bowler
flipped around the corner to get Trott on strike. Already Morgan finding the gaps better than Bell did
flatter from Razzak and it's pushed to cover
perfectly straight bat meets an equally straight ball
Razzak really hurtling through his overs, England suddenly look up at the scoreboard to see 18 overs have gone
excellent work from Morgan, skips down and drives firmly. Only a diving stop at mid-on saved a boundary
Trott is careful, squeezing a prodded defence
this is better from the batsman, more decisiveness pushing down to long-on
Morgan whips his hands over the ball to send it around the corner
full-faced defence but Trott finds a gap wide of cover
Morgan wanted a single but was quickly sent back as an inside edge ran towards fine leg
smart fielding from mid-on pins Trott on the strike
despite dropping his bat, Morgan returned safely to the bowler's end to complete a swift double. Trott shuffling across his stumps to work to leg
smart fielding at midwicket keeps this to a single as Trott flicks to leg
hint of width is enough for Morgan to unfurl a cut shot, which he doesn't time all that well
dragged down from Razzak and Trott heaves an awkward-looking pull shot away
this runs off the inside  edge into the midwicket region
on off stump, defneded
onto the back foot and whipped along the ground to deep midwicket
round the wicket, on middle and defended off the inside edge to the leg side
finally some intent and no surprise it's from Morgan as he uses his feet and lofts this over midwicket
defended to the off side
cut away towards backward point and he keeps the strike
greeted by a lovely lofted off drive from Morgan, just opened the face and lifted the ball over mid-off and it almost carried for six
touch quicker and flatter, defended back to the bowler
worked from outside off down to long on
round the wicket, angling into Trott who defends
pushed towards leg stump, takes the pad and the keeper collects
drives into the covers and can't find the gap...Trott can't leave all the scoring to Morgan
on the back foot, opens the face but doesn't risk a single to backward point
tossed up from round the wicket, pushed into the covers for a tight single as Trott has to get a wriggle on
whipped off the back foot out to deep midwicket
fuller on off stump, Morgan caught on the back foot but is able to defend
more excellent footwork from Morgan as he skips down the pitch outside off then chips expertly over midwicket with sweet enough timing to beat long on
cut out to the deep cover sweeper
takes this from well outside off stump into a gap in the leg side...he works the field so well
bunted out to midwicket
tries to drive but the ball just dribbles to mid-on
that's nicely done, he waited for it and played that favourite whip shot through the leg side
tossed up on off stump, driven down the ground
takes the pad into the off side
again on the back foot and whipped to square leg
finds the gap this time out to deep midwicket
dragged down short and Morgan is so quickly into position as he pulls it all along the ground through midwicket
tucked off leg stump to short fine leg
worked down to long on
is this the breakthrough? Trott struggling to make his ground as Morgan calls for a quick single to cover. Gee, it's mighty close. A missing frame job. He just made it. But it was very tight.
edged! good start from Rubel as Morgan pushes outside off but it didn't quite carry to the keeper then eluded his grasp. Races down to third man
loses his line down the leg side
full on the stumps, driven firmly back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven sweetly but straight to cover
nicely bowled on middle and off, defended back to Rubel
tight on middle, nothing for Morgan to work with and he defends to cover
ooh, offered some width but he slashes and misses - undone by a lack of bounce
touch short, allows Trott to stay on the back foot to whip it out through midwicket...brings up England's 100, but it's been hard work
round the wicket, on middle, pushed out to midwicket
pulled down short, there was some turn but very slow and Morgan easily works it into the square-leg area
pushed into the covers
turned out to midwicket and it goes too quickly to allow a single
clever from Trott as he brings out the reverse sweep and gets it fine of short third man, but not quite enough pace to reach the rope
great timing...a touch short from Rubel and it's just a flick off his hip from Trott, bisected fine leg and deep square at pace. Trott's first boundary
fuller this time on off stump, pushed down to long on
ooh, well bowled, he cuts Morgan in half with one that nips back off the seam to the left hander
defended into the off side
uses his feet and is taken on the pad, half an appeal but it's outside leg stump and the result is a couple of leg byes to fine leg
pushed into the covers
that very familiar shot from Trott as he whips it through square leg off the back foot and some good running makes it two
worked away from middle stump along the ground through midwicket
brings out the sweep, gets a bottom edge which goes very fine and despite a hard chase the fielder can't pull it in
defended into the leg side
on off stump, defended again
tries to cut but can't beat pont
back of a length, pushed firmly down to long on
opens the face and plays to backward point
big appeal, Morgan plays across the line and misses but it may have pitched outside leg and they don't review...it was the right decision
tight line on off stump, Morgan can't beat backward point
uses his feet, meets it on the full and finds the gap between cover and mid-off with superb timing...more excellent placement from Morgan. This is a gem of an innings
drives again and finds mid-off
bustles in energetically as always but the line is wide and Trott drives to cover
Trott tries to steer this behind point but finds the man
happily picked off to deep square, it's rare Trott misses out on his legs
touch too short and enough width for Morgan to steer a cut shot to deep third man
slower ball around off stump which Trott spots but can only pat to cover
stabbed into the ground and it bounces up over Shafiul's out-stretched hand for one
Trott is on the reverse-sweep, not playing it entirely cleaning and it dribbles away for one
Morgan on the reverse, big wind up as always but he too doesn't quite time it
with men set behind square for the reverse Morgan has a big gap in front of square to thump a couple into
and this time with the softest of hands he runs a single to point
too short from Shakib, plenty of time for Trott to sit on the back foot and slug out to deep cover

Shakib thinks he has Trott on review. It spun from around middle and clipped the top of the pad, right in front of off stump as Trott played back. Agonisingly, it's just an on-field call, the ball clipping off stump,  so Bangladesh lose both reviews
bit of grunt from Shafiul as he delivers and it slides off the face down to third man
Trott times a fuller ball very firmly down the ground to mid-off
Trott on the walk, ambling up the crease before prodding to point and haring a single
big wind up from Morgan, looked like he wanted to flip into the leg side, but the line was too close to off and he had to defend
good yorker here, Shafiul bustling in as usual but finding a good line this time
very tight line cramps Morgan for room and it can only be patted back to the bowler
Shakib buoyant after that close shout and forcing Trott to defend
worked carefully off middle into the leg side
Morgan is timing the ball so well these chip shots are almost dangerous, it flies two-bounces out to the man at deep midwicket
prodded from the crease into the leg side
Trott pushes to cover and sets off for a tight single
sloppy from Bangladesh, misfield at cover turns a dot into two. Just a dangerous period for the home side here, they're letting a very good start be undone
this keeps a touch low and with Trott sitting on the back foot he had to hurriedly stab it out on the leg side
flash and a miss outside off stump! It was up there to drive but Morgan, one away from 50, missed it

fifty for Morgan, his 11th and, in the circumstances, one of the best. Coming off the back of a flight from England he's sauntered into a tense World Cup encounter on a sluggish pitch and played dreamily
Trott solidly pushes a single down the ground. What a contrasting pair these two are

exchange of words from the fiery Shafiul and flinty Morgan. Strange to see Morgan drawn into any of that. It was a full ball that came off an inside edge back to Shafiul who fielded in his follow through
ah, very calmly done. After the words last delivery no hint of anything but clear thinking and Morgan coolly flicks wide of deep midwicket
touch too short again from Shakib but Trott mistimes his drive
again Trott is allowed to play off the back foot and works this easily to deep square
tossed up a touch here and invited Morgan down the wicket to flick just wide of midwicket
pushed back to the bowler

fifty for Mr Consistency. Utter silence from the crowd, they've got more to worry about. Trott raises his bat but has nothing to acknowledge so quickly brings it back down again. Crucial innings though
Morgan gets forward to defends
Shafiul has found a decent rhythm here, landing another yorker that Trott squeezes to midwicket
deftly worked off the face to third man
full and straight ball meets a full and straight bat to milk down to long-on
nicely done from the batsman, couple of steps down the wicket before flicking around the corner
good slower ball deceives Morgan enough to force a defence
precise timing, precise placement, wonderful shot. Very easily flicked off the legs wide of deep midwicket for four. Shafiul looks despondent but not much wrong from him
Trott picks off a single into the off side
blocked carefully off the front foot
too short and a touch too much width, allows Morgan to hammer a cut  to deep point
another chip shot flipped up over the infield towards midwicket
Trott sits on the back foot and works to square leg
nicely-judged single from Trott, getting deep into his crease to drag this from outside off to mid-on
starts well, around middle and Trott's nudge finds midwicket
Trott aims his favourite work to leg but can't get anything on it
this time Trott finds the shot and ambles a single

magic for Bangladesh! Brilliant catch has brought them back into the game. Imrul Kayes running in from deep fine leg and diving to scoop the ball inches from the turf. Morgan got just too much top-edge on a sweep and it was enough to end a mighty comeback innings
Bopara watches the spin and prods it around the corner
touch short means the ball sits up and allows Bopara to punch a single down the ground and steal the strike
driven firmly but straight to cover
more air from Shakib here and Bopara's flowing drive heads out to deep cover. They think about two but neither are great runners
too short again from Shakib, how many times has he been too short today!? Trott needs no second invitation to whip through midwicket and times it well enough to beat a tumbling effort on the boundary
spin here, real spin from outside leg
carefully blocked this time
threaded away for a single
brings out the reverse sweep again, goes very fine past the keeper and pulls up just short of the rope
defended to the on side
pushed into the covers
good stuff, fired in at leg stump and played to the leg side
touch short outside off, Bopara opens the face and forces it square through the covers
short outside off, chopped away out to deep cover
dragged down short, pulled away but can't beat midwicket who dives well
plays round his front pad into the leg side
pushed down to long on
on the back foot and whipped out to midwicket
walks around his crease but ends up being taken on he pad

is this out? Trott struggling to make his ground again, but the throw is poor and with a stretch he makes it. Bopara had given himself room to drive through the off side, but rifled it straight at cover. A good throw and Trott was gone
driven down to long off
worked into the leg side and the fielder is quickly onto it
misses out on a pull as Razzak drags it short
another dot ball, doesn't connect with the sweep and is taken on the pad
another quick single to cover as Trott drives, but this time it's a little more comfortable
moves around the crease but just tickles it to short fine leg
goes for a big sweep but the ball turns outside off and he's nowhere near it
gives himself room to drive but, for the third time, picks out cover
down the pitch but Shakib saw him coming and pulled his length back, all Bopara could do was tap a single to midwicket
gone! That was on the cards...pressure building, Trott tried to go straight down the ground but could only pick out long off. Well bowled and reward for keeping the runs down
drives out to cover
that's the way to do it...first ball Swann brings out the reverse hit over cover, connects well and collects the first boundary of the Powerplay
backs away to leg and yet again finds the fielder on the edge of the cover ring
fired in at leg stump and Swann works it out to square leg
finally manages to get one through the covers, did well to connect well enough as it didn't bounce much but it was very short and gave Bopara plenty of time
lofted straight down the ground and Swann is quickly back to the non-striker's end
another goes in the Powerplay...Bopara's struggle is over as he backs away and slaps it straight to cover. He couldn't play the finishing role today
drifts down the leg side, misses everything so a bonus ball for England
pushes forward with bat and pad together, Swann wants a single but has to turn quickly to get back
starts with a good leg-stump yorker which Swann can only drill back down the pitch
on target again with a yorker, angled down to short third man
down the pitch and makes it into a full toss which is then whipped through square leg...brings up England's 200
uses his feet again and works another full ball through straight midwicket
doesn't pitch again, Swann backs away to give himself room and thumps it well over mid-off
that's better, right at the base of leg stump which means Swann can only dig it out down the ground
gives himself room and cuts into the off side
down the pitch and gets into a tangle
opens the face and pushes into the off side
gone...Swann's reverse hit brings his downfall as he skies it very high and Shakib steadies himself underneath the catch
the batsmen crossed when Swann was out, so Collingwood works away out to deep midwicket
nicely driven through the off side by Bresnan who places it wide of long off
missed run out! Rubel couldn't collect the ball at the stumps and Bresnan would have been miles out. Collingwood had work it through midwicket and it was never two runs
stays very deep in his crease and clubs down to long on
gone! England falling away at the end as Bresnan swings at a low full toss and sends a simple catch to backward point. Bresnan waited to see if it was above waist height but it's fine
uses his feet again and pushes this down to long on
no repeat of his first-ball six against India as he's beaten outside off by one that scoots through
driven into the covers so he'll keep the strike
gone! full, straight, Shahzad had a swing and missed. Superb finish to the innings for Bangladesh. Not very clever from Shahzad
cracker first up, moves away past Anderson's outside edge...too good for the No. 11
pushed across well wide of off stump and that'll be an extra
beaten again outside off, top stuff from Shafiul
beaten again...three times in the over, very full and it reverses past the outside edge
superb delivery, a full, late, reverse swinger which Anderson someone edges down to third man

excellent finish...it's full and wide, Collingwood tries to jab it away but is beaten and they can't steal a bye. Then, quite oddly, the umpire's decide to ask to check with the third umpire. It can't be a Bangladesh review as they had none left, but it looks like they were persuaded to check
he does what needs to, opens the face and pushes into the off side
stands deep in the crease and heaves down to long on...Anderson races back and a poor throw means he makes it
bunted down to long on, the throw goes to the batsman's end this time but Collingwood is safe
gone...all out, England don't see out 50 overs. A low full toss is pulled into midwicket, the fielder races it and with a strong throw hits direct

inn2.comm: short ball, which is revealing, might not be many in Tamim's half. Slow pitch to do that on. Worked off the arm around the corner towards fine leg
again Anderson is back of a length and trying to tuck Tamim for space, looks like it comes off the pads and bobbles towards Prior
Imrul also likes to have a dash but here he is a picture of resistance, waving Anderson through to the keeper
Anderson finds some early swing and celebrates by appealing as Imrul is struck high on the pad. The umpire indicates it was going over, it was
touch of swing again, that will keep Anderson smiling. Imrul is rooted to the crease a touch and defending with his hands
again Imrul is defeated by swing as the ball bends past his inside edge and crashes into his thigh
starts tidily enough, searching for swing at a full length outside off stump
this is close enough for Tamim and he flicks with the around-the-wicket angle through the leg side for a couple

flick of the wrists earns Tamim three, would have been four but for an excellent full-length slide along the square-leg boundary from Morgan. It was full around middle and off and Tamim just whipped his wrists through the delivery
Imrul apes Tamim, though without the same panache and works a single towards square leg
not the right place to bowl really, on the pads and Tamim can help himself to a single
beaten! Much better delivery here, lands just outside off and zips away past a groping outside edge
good work from Anderson, hammering that back of a length and leaving Tamim with no room to cut
all the best batsmen are good judges of a single and Tamim is one of the best, drops this to mid-off and scoots off
Anderson is holding his length and line outside off stump, Imrul shapes to play before deciding against it
shorter delivery but the line remains impeccable
ball carrying through quite nicely off the dewy surface and slides off the edge to third man

oh no, Bopara fluffs a save on the fine leg boundary and turns one into four! It wasn't a great deliver - shoved down the leg side - but Tamim's work didn't deserve four. Bopara just overran it a touch
another thickish edge earns Imrul  a single
with fine leg wide and the angle from around the wicket this - on the pads - is no place to be bowling. Tamim is delighted and flicks around the corner. he's up and running now!
much better from the bowler, outside off stump and blocked. Shahzad looks thoroughly unamused at the moment
full again and the line, crucially, is outside off. Tamim thumps a drive towards mid-on
worked to fine leg with the angle from around the wicket. He looks in good order so far
false shot! And we haven't had many, just a touch of outswing finding a leading edge
three more for Tamim and he barely touched this, full on and around middle and he flicked it beautifully in front of midwicket to send Bresnan on a long chase
left alone outside off stump
banged in short from Anderson, the line was wrong but Imrul couldn't quite swing it away as he wanted
the dew has the England fielders sliding all over the place. It helps Collingwood here save a single at point
England are very keen to give no room outside off which means there is plenty of opportunity to work to leg
ah, touch of style, touch of class. Touch short from Anderson and Tamim go up on one-leg and short-hand whipped it through square leg. Shades of a certain Lara there
solid start from Bresnan, up and around middle on a length
England taking a hiding now! Imrul Kayes this time landing a picture-perfect straight drive, full face of the blade and it rushes past mid-off
back of a length here and Imrul pops up on his toes to defend
smartly played here as some extra bounce surprises Imrul, but he rides with it and guides to third man
fantastic stop from Bopara at short fine leg saves four, diving full length, picking up and throwing as Tamim flicked around the corner
again it's on the pads but the leg glance finds the infielder
Anderson finds his ideal delivery, back of a length around middle and off. Tamim defends
what a strike! Anderson's line drifts a touch down the leg side, Tamim is up on one leg again and screaming a pull shot to the boundary
that forces Anderson to go full and Tamim aims a booming drive to cover but can't time it
there's the width that England have been desperate to contain, Tamim flashes at the opportunity and it heads towards the point boundary
Anderson is lucky here, full on leg stump but Tamim's flick finds short fine leg

he loves that! Full and wide it was only going to end one way. Feet go nowhere but the bat flows through the line and he holds the poise, or pose, as the ball skims to the boundary. Tamim is flying and the crowd love Bangladesh again
slippery ball or what I don't now but this was really floated up, long half-volley outside off stump and Imrul clattered it wide of cover to bring up the 50-stand. That didn't take long!
better ball this time, flatter and around middle stump. Imrul works to fine leg
zooter/slider/ball that doesn't spin. Imrul leaves alone
touch fuller and pushed back to the bowler
best ball of the innings here, dragging Imrul forward in defence
so after a poor first ball Swann finishes well but he's not at all happy with the conditions. Can't grip the ball, he tells the umpire
huge appeal from England as Tamim aims and misses a squeezed cut shot. Flicked the top of the pad through to Prior and was neither an edge or out lbw
venture near the pads and Tamim will happily flick through midwicket
big wind up and bat swing from Tamim here as he tries to drill down the ground. Possibly tried to overhit it though and the timing was hideous
silence in Chittagong! Crowd dumb struck as Bresnan strikes! Fullish length but Tamim was hanging back and just played across the ball a touch. It burst through and onto the stumps
Bresnan hammers a length and line and Junaid blocks
banged in much shorter and Junaid wheels a pull down to fine leg
Swann aims full and it's gently patted back to the bowler. All the bite has gone for the moment
that will help! Horrid full toss slips out and Junaid could pick his spot, shoving it through midwicket for four
bit of a misfield now at midwicket. Poor Swann, he is not at all happy
flight, touch of spin, good line. Treated with utmost respect
Imrul aims a big swish-sweep but fails to connect
carefully pushed to cover
no slip and that edge has gone straight where one would have been stood as Siddique aimed to play through third man
short ball and Siddique goes for the pull but doesn't make contact
goes full at the stumps, met with a full face and driven back down the pitch
wrong line, on leg stump like so much of England's bowling and worked out to deep square
leg stump again and neatly flicked away by Kayes...Shahzad slides round on his knees to cut off the boundary
compensates by going full outside off, it's well driven but short cover makes a sharp save
tossed up full, calmly pushed down to long off
connects with a sweep and gets it fine of deep square leg
dragged short outside off but Kayes can't beat the cover field as he cuts
good line on middle and off, Kayes plays forward and defends
drifting onto leg stump which gives the batsman a chance to work the ball out to deep square
on off stump, defended into the covers
opens the face to guide a wide ball down to third man

Is this gone?! Excellent fielding from Anderson who hits direct at the non-striker's end with a swivel and throw. This is mighty close. One angle is more clear than the other and Siddique seems short of the crease. Indeed he's gone. He played the ball into the leg side but was late responding to Kayes' call, while Anderson produced a pin-point throw
beaten outside off, Bresnan pushes one across which moves away a touch more...good line
well bowled again as the batsman gets squared up and a leading edge rolls into the covers
works this off the stumps through midwicket
on off stump and Raqibul is solidly behind his first ball
and he nearly gets through straight away as Kayes chops a defensive push down in front of the stumps and the ball bobbles near the timber
full on the stumps with a hint of swing, Kayes almost gets into a tangle as he plays across his pad into midwicket
full outside off, it's driven hard into the ground without much timing
wrong line down the leg side and Prior gets an awkward bounce so gives away another extra
gone! That's a beauty from Shahzad. You can't play them. Pitched on off, held its line to beat the edge and ripped out off stump. Unplayable.
on off stump and driven firmly into the covers
short ball on leg stump, Shakib neatly turns his wrists to send it down to long leg
good line on off stump, Shakib defends square on the off side
pushed across outside off, doesn't quite bounce as much and gets the toe-end of the bat to point
offers up some width but Shakib's cut takes the bottom of the bat then falls short of Prior, who parries it past slip as he dives
full and wide, draws a loose drive from Kayes who was nowhere near it
closer to off stump and that's a better defensive shot square to point
on middle and off, defended into the leg side
on off stump, Shakib waits on the back foot and drives firmly into the covers
touch straight this time which allows Shakib to turn it down to long leg
that's pretty awful all round from England...fired down the leg side then Prior lets it through his legs. It did bounce low, but no excuse for the keeper
back on middle stump, worked out to midwicket
on middle and off, defended to the leg side
this is better from Shahzad, stays on off stump and it's pushed back to the bowler
oh dear, another one down the leg side...he's just forcing it a little
on the stumps, worked backward of square on the leg side
on the stumps and pushed into the leg side
full on the pads, worked along the ground to deep square
down the leg side, neat take this time but another extra England can't afford
still too straight and it allows another single into the leg side
this isn't very clever from England as another one pushed down the leg side
flicked in the air through square...about two of the last dozen deliveries have been on off stump
that's better, full on off stump and it's driven to mid-off
cuts and misses outside off, it skidded through a touch more which beat the shot
round the wicket, full on off stump and driven down to mid-off
angled into the pads, Kayes doesn't connect as it bobbles into the leg side
ooh, was that half a chance? Indeed it was. Punched back by Shakib but Shahzad couldn't get his right hand down in his follow through
uses the angle created from round the wicket to work it through midwicket
well bowled! A cracking yorker which zeros in on Kayes' feet but somehow misses the stumps
full outside off, driven in the air but it goes wide of backward point down to third man
full on off stump and gets driven to mid-off
shorter from Bopara and it's worked down to fine leg...plenty of time to play short stuff on this pitch
wrong line again, this is poor from Bopara - he's only a medium pacer - and it gets clipped away to fine leg
an appeal for lbw but that pitched well outside leg so there's no point reviewing it
full on the stumps, punched firmly back to Bopara in his follow through
neatly played as he opens the face to guide down to third man...sensible batting is all Bangladesh need
another excellent yorker, jamming into the batsman's toes and he does well to keep it out
nicely turned away off the stumps through midwicket...they think of two but after the earlier run out decide against it
full on the stumps and the angle works in the left-hander's favour as he gets another single into midwicket...Shahzad can't get straight from round the wicket
that's horrid, pushed way down the leg side...there has been some tripe served up by England
lovely shot, just leant on it and sends it racing straight down the ground for a welcome boundary
comes out as a low full toss but Kayes can only drive it to short cover
on middle and off, defended with a straight bat
anyway, back in a real sport Anderson has replaced Bopara and starts well, around off stump. Pushed to cover
full again, no reverse swing at the moment. Dewy ball and all. Bunted out to cover
have all of those. Stand and delivery. Huge pressure on Shakib but he looks calm. This was in his range and he just slapped his arms through the to send it pinging to the rope
slower ball is turned down to fine leg. Very good little stand this
another picture-perfect straight drive from Imrul, he's nailed a few of those today. Took a sprawling save from mid-off
Shakib on the straight drive this time, and again it took some smart fielding from mid-off to intercept
starts well, touch of flight and Imrul solidly forward in defence. No hurry for Bangladesh here if they play sensibly this game is for the taking
ooh, dry ball finds big spin. Real ripper past the outside edge. Kept very low too
Swann tosses this up, he really fancies this after that last delivery, slides off the edge towards third man
big follow through from Swann after Shakib pops this back to him in defence
Shakib very careful against Swann, prodding to the leg side

huge appeal from England but all they get is a wide from the umpire. It was down the leg side, Shakib misses a leg-side flick. Prior and Swann are convinced but Strauss is having none of it, doesn't fancy a review
Swann is furious still, but lands a good delivery that finds a slight leading edge. On replay Swann is right to be annoyed that it was given a wide, because it hit the leg, but it wasn't an edge
this is the seam-up variety of Collingwood's bowling and a touch wide too, driven square of the wicket out towards the point boundary
more of a cutter this time and driven to cover. Hint of a mix-up between the batsmen but they corrected in time
touch of spin here and Imrul defends carefully
misfield at cover threatens to give away a single but the fielder recovered quickly
Anderson let this through him, diving at short cover and then long-off is slow  to respond which allows a swiftly-taken couple
decent start from Collingwood but England need a breakthrough
Swann is the man for England, he looks most likely of finding a wicket. Touch short here though and Shakib cuts firmly
good delivery is resolutely kept out
slip in place for Swann who is tossing up invitingly but Imrul is solid in defence
quicker ball fired through, just a touch too short and was cut sharply but Strauss fielded well at point
good tumbling fielding from Bopara at mid-on prevents Shakib from turning the strike back over
nicely done from Shakib, couple of steps down the ground and pushed to long-off
Collingwood tosses this up a touch and is driven to cover
this time Shakib straightens his drive to milk a single down to long-off
pushed to point as Collingwood tosses this up again
spin and bounce for Collingwood! Imrul prodded suspiciously at it
good bowling here, full and straight. Driven back to him
excellent batting, that's all they need to do. Careful drive threaded through the infield towards deep point, smart running earns two
Shakib plays around his front pad and a touch of spin defeats the fiddle
booming sweep aimed but Swann is bowling excellently and Shakib can't get much of it
better shot this time, worked carefully around the corner
touch too short to cause Imrul problems as this is driven back at the bowler
single taken this time, Imrul punching a backfoot drive straight of extra cover
again this is dragged down, Swann exclaims as he delivers, he needs to get a grip (chortle). Cut hard to deep cover and Swann hoofs the turf in disgust
Collingwood flights this cutter a touch and is driven to cover
prodded to cover again
good work from Collingwood, pinning Imrul to the crease
touch too short and too wide as well, cut fine and it scoots, all along the damp outfield, towards the third man rope. England are looking very glum at the moment
diving stop, flinging himself to his left at cover keeps this to one. But singles are all Bangladesh need here
quiet and tidy over ticks by but England need a moment of inspiration to lift themselves here. One wicket and pressure will suddenly switch but for now Bangladesh are coasting
that's certainly not it, long-hop sat up but Shakib's pull shot went straight to fine leg
flash and a miss outside off stump! Not a great delivery but it scurried under the edge
fifty for Imrul and an absolutely crucial one. Gets there by steering this out to third man for a couple
flash a miss again outside off! Just a hint of reverse as well bending it past the edge
won't swing from that length. Banged in too short and speared down the leg side. Imrul worked it with the angle for a single towards fine leg

Shakib wanted a single here that didn't exist as he prodded this to midwicket. Another wicketless over ticks by and Bangladesh are edging closer. Certain favourites from here but England games don't end easily
dropped towards point where the fielder hares in and fluffs the pick up. Might have been tight otherwise
have to respect Shakib's guts here, all the pressure of the nation on him and he's working the ball around smartly, picking off singles to guide this chase
Imrul follows in the mould by dinking to midwicket and heading off for one
touch too close for Shakib to try and force through the off side and he can't time it
grunt from Collingwood as he fires this in, skids onto Shakib who can't squeeze a cut away
cry of catch from the fielders but it went into a big gap at cover
play and miss outside off, this really did keep low. Shakib swung well over the ball
another false shot, inside edge this time squirts down to fine leg
wow, very delicate from Imrul, opening the face at the last moment to steer down to third man
Shakib manages to squeeze a cut shot out to cover
lovely shot, floaty half-volley but Imrul leant into it and creamed a drive through cover to bring up his 1000th ODI run
blimey! Not sure what happened here but Bopara ended up landing this near his toe and it it looped up gently and wide outside off stump. Horrid
shoved down the leg side a touch and it runs off the pads towards fine leg
round the wicket, worked off leg stump down to long leg
goes back in his crease and works it out to deep midwicket
driven square to point
lovely little dab sweep from Shakib, sends it very fine but long leg can get around
one hand comes off the bat as he drives but there's a single to midwicket

What's happened here?! Kayes gifted his wicket. They've gone upstairs for the run out but he looks well short. Oh dear, that's not what Bangladesh needed. Shahzad sent in a rocket throw from deep square, but there was no need to even chance the second.
wide outside off, cut away to backward point and nearly another mix-up in the running as point makes a diving stop
round the wicket and defended into the off side
on off stump, pushes towards mid-on who is fairly deep and this time there's a safe quick single
full outside off, defended into the covers
ooh, well bowled, hint of reverse swing which is a good effort and Rahim does well to dig it out
back of a length outside off, driven square on the off side
cutter from round the wicket, Shakib dabs it towards the leg side
touch short and gives Shakib time to work it out to deep square
worked off middle to midwicket
tight on the stumps and Rahim can only defend
big appeal for lbw and Strauss calls for  review. There are two noises, but no bat. Looks to be heading down the leg side and indeed it is so Rahim survives
full outside off and it's sweetly driven out to deep cover
pushed down the leg side and that's another to England's wide tally, but a good take from Prior
on off stump, defended to mid-on
very full outside off, driven hard but straight to cover
good line, back of a length and defended down the pitch
bang on off stump from Bresnan, Rahim defends from the crease
a little fuller so Rahim drives off the front foot but Bresnan gets down in his follow through to stop it
offers up some width but gets away with it as Rahim picks out cover...a good over from Bresnan
full on off stump, driven to backward point
touch too short, gives Shakib time to go on the back foot and drive out to the cover sweeper
floated up outside, goes for the drive but doesn't time or place it and picks out cover
full at the stumps, that one was actually nicely timed but Collingwood stuck out a foot to stop it...could have been nasty
outside off and left alone...another dot to Rahim
well bowled, squares up Rahim and takes a leading edge into the off side
starts with an arm ball, angles into Shakib who defends to the off side
waits for this outside off and chops to backward point
just a touch short and it's pushed out to deep cover
turn for Swann but it was too short so Rahim to rock back and place it towards backward point
strangled shout from Prior but there was a big inside edge on that
gone! There's the breakthrough, pressure tells and the captain goes. Shakib tries to sweep from well outside off and gets a bottom edge into off stump
a welcome boundary, full outside off and Rahim drives beautifully between cover and mid-off...Rahim will like the extra pace
gone! Maybe he won't. Shahzad strikes with another beauty. Like the ball to get Raqibul this one just straightens outside off to find the edge and Prior takes a fine low catch diving to his right
full on off stump with a hint of shape, defended watchfully into the covers
dragged short and wide, but Anderson makes a diving save at cover to support his fellow fast bowler
beaten outside off although Naeem tried to pull the bat inside the line...barely carried through to Prior
full outside off stump, Naeem onto the front foot and defends
outside off, chopped down to backward point
onto the front foot, hint of spin and an appeal for lbw but not much chance of that
comes forward again to defend onto the leg side
nice flight from Swann, gives it a chance to turn and it takes the pad again into the off side
fuller and prodded into the leg side...more pressure
probing outside off, he leans forward to defend and that's a controlling maiden from Swann
another gone! Beauty No.3 from Shahzad and it's an action replay of the others as it nips away late from Naeem who plays down the line. This time the off stump takes another blow
full at the stumps, dug out into the leg side
for some reason Shahzad appeals for this but it pitched miles outside leg as it takes the pad into the leg side
on off stump, worked into the leg side
shapes away outside off and draws Mahmudullah forward but was just a little wide to find the edge
full outside off, drives hard and one hand comes off the bat...the edge goes to third man
on off stump, can only pat it back down the pitch
a little too straight and allows him to turn it through square
round the wicket, tossed up on middle, driven into the covers

gone! England have held a blinder, it's Bresnan at long on. Razzak tried to swing it high over midwicket, the ball went miles into the night sky and Bresnan tracked it all the way before diving full length to hold the chance.
beaten outside off as he tries to guide to third man
wide of off stump, comes into the front foot and pushes it square on the off side
good lines from Shahzad, full searching for that destructive swing. Defended carefully
again Shahzad is full and straight but Mahmudullah doing his best to resist the inevitable
precious inside edge squirts into the leg side. England will be through if they win this Bangladesh, technically will still have a chance
play and a miss outside off stump, England much brighter now they were a shambles earlier on. Credit has to go to Strauss for holding them together, just about. And that awful run out
uneasy defence to finish but Bangladesh look spent here. Stony faces in the dressing room
tossed up by Swann and Mahmudullah leans forward to defend
sharp spin sends this down the leg side where Prior holds a good take
plenty of people have left the ground but one-reverse sweep later and the crowd are in full voice. It will be such a shame if they go out, these supporters are more passionate than any
inside edge runs away behind square for another wildly-cheered single
maybe! This was O'Brien-esque! Big wind up and even bigger swing through the line, sending it over cover whistling to the rope
this time Shafiul leans forward to defend
The KOB!? Shot Shafiul! Stood still, leant back and swung this a mile over long-on!
crowd alive again as Shahzad spears this down the leg side. Smiles have returned in the space of four deliveries!
Mahmudullah very calmly drops this to point. He moves in slow motion
again Shahzad is back of a length around off stump. Mahmudullah calmly drops to point again
top bowling this, full and fast, threatening to swing. Mahmudullah jabs it quietly to cover but the crowd still cheer wildly
flick off the pads earns Mahmudullah a single. He then marches down to his parter to issue some advice
not sure what Mahmudullah suggested but I doubt it was this! Horrid flat-footed swish outside off at thin air. One ball left for Shahzad...
driven off the toe-end to mid-off to end an excellent final spell from Shahzad. He's bowled some bad balls but three beauties to pull England almost to victory. Almost
steered coolly down to third man. Rubel's record doesn't inspire confidence
slower short ball, not a great delivery but not a great shot either. Shafiul swishing at fresh air
just as Anderson finds a straight ball Shafiul tightens up his technique and very correctly strokes this to mid-on
width again from Anderson, once more Shafiul aims an almighty thwack at nothing, Mahmudullah rushes through for a bye but gets struck on the hand as Prior's throw comes in
Mahmudullah is perfectly cool, suave even, as his drops this to cover to pinch a single
back of a length and very straight from Anderson, nowhere for Shafiul to go
hammers on a length and line straight away. No questions of looseners. Angling in to the body from back of a length and Mahmudullah can only prod to leg
same length forcing Mahmudullah back as he punches to cover
Bresnan is such a reliable character and he's leaving nowhere for Mahmudullah to go
edged but it falls short. Again the line and length is impeccable but soft hands allows Mahmudullah to survive
precious single thuds off the pads and dribbles out towards square leg. The scrapping, bustling Shafiul calls through a single
ooh, unlucky for Shafiul here. Nailed his drive but picked out cover. Two foot either side and it would have been four
...are answered here! Heady stuff for the Bangladeshis as Anderson spears this down the leg side, off it went past Prior and skimmed away for five wides!
down the leg side again, Mahmudullah clips classily to deep square. What a better option he is than Ashraful
push and go from Shafiul! Very smart, just sat back, dropped it to mid-off and hared down the other end. The single is greeted with jumping ovations from the crowd
meanwhile Mahmudullah looks like he's playing a Sunday park match, easing forward to defend to cover
not there  Anderson, not there! Slipped too far down the leg side again
and another! What is going on? Pressure, pressure, pressure. What crazy things it produces
that's the place to bowl. On a length around off stump, Mahmudullah pops forward to defend
the magic of clear thinking and soft hands gets Mahmudullah a single, dropped to cover
ooh, the bowler is lucky to get away with this. Speared down leg again but Shafiul missed his clip and it thudded away off the pad
Bresnan on the mark, as always. Shafiul tries to give himself room and squeeze a drive away but can't time it
width is always dangerous and Shafiul has struck gold. Just flung his arms at the width on offer and sliced it down towards third man where Trott slid along the boundary but couldn't keep it in
appeal from Bresnan but this was heading down leg, in fact, he's lucky a leg bye is all it was. 17 needed!
careful work from Mahmudullah, threading this through the infield to tick another run off
full toss from Bresnan and Shafiul is playing a blinder! Oh England, losing their heads just at the finish line! Creamed wide of point and it raced to the boundary. Shafiul is pumped!
another expansive drive, the beans are going for Shafiul but he can't time this

Mahmudullah cool as you like, flips a full delivery around the corner to bring Shafiul back. Singles will do it, Bangladesh are nearly there, just need to hold their nerves. Anderson needs a moment of inspiration
good delivery, Anderson lands it on a length and line and Shafiul treats it with the respect it deserved
Shafiul take a bow! What a stroke, what bottle! Gets one in his half, backs himself to do it and crashes back past the bowler for four to bring up  the 50 stand
runs continue to flow, the crowd who stayed have been rewarded with a gem. Bobbles off the pads here but Bangladesh just one big strike away
Anderson tumbles as he delivers, England are very much on the mat now. Mahmudullah carefully defends
late swing takes this towards the pads and Mahmudullah keeps the strike by flicking around the corner
another hugely-cheered leg bye. Extras have played a blinder here. Back of a length, thuds off the thigh and Mahmudullah scoots through
excellent cricket all round. Bresnan holding his nerve with a yorker and Shafiul smart enough to try nothing silly and just carefully block it out
edged! Precious edge earns a single to third man. The stadium is absolutely heaving
ooh, excellent delivery. Full and straight, heading for off stump until the wide blade of Mahmudullah eases into line
Mahmudullah skips up the track here and Bresnan responds by banging it in short. Glanced to short midwicket and plenty of nervous faces in the crowds

Mahmudullah has done it! Bangladesh have done it! What an a partnership! Brilliant victory is sealed by Mahmudullah punching a drive through the covers. The Bangladesh players come streaming onto the field, Mahmudullah stands arms aloft and the World Cup party is back on!
